intro: Psychotria atricaulis, commonly known as the black-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria atricaulis is also notable for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its uses.
